item.title: BCEL Problem
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

It’s a while since I worked with BCEL. However you your code is wrong on many parts.
You try to add a method called setWorld(int world). In that you give a this refference, but then decide to call a static method which is itself but not completely because you don’t the arguments and you want it to be static? I don’t think you understand what you where doing.

Instead just do this:

//Start up
ClassGen client = findClass("client"); //or whatever you use to get the client ClassGen
ConstantPoolGen cpg = client.getConstantPool(); //for quick access

cpg.setConstant(cpg.lookupUtf8("127.0.0.1"), new ConstantUtf8("world53.runescape.com")); //change "127.0.0.1" to "world53.runescape.com"

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL Problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Well basically i want to insert this method:

public String setWorld(int WorldID) {
    return ("world" +WorldID+ ".runescape.com");
}

into client.class, and then where the “127.0.0.1” is, call this method with some number(I just changed the code). So replace 127.0.0.1, with setWorld(63).

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL Problem
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:1, topic:249641”]Hello, I’m trying to change the web address in the client, so that it calls the setWorld() method. I have a code, that puts the method in the client, but it doesn’t function properly:

InstructionList setWorldInstructions = new InstructionList();
MethodGen setWorldMethod = new MethodGen(0, Type.STRING, Args, WorldArgs, "setWorld", Generator.getClassName(), setWorldInstructions, ConstantPool);
														
InstructionFactory Factory = new InstructionFactory(Generator, ConstantPool);
Instruction pushThis = new ALOAD(0);
Instruction getCurrentWorld = Factory.createFieldAccess(Generator.getClassName(),"setWorld()", Type.STRING, Constants.GETSTATIC);
Instruction returnWorld = Factory.createReturn(Type.STRING);
														
setWorldInstructions.append(pushThis);
setWorldInstructions.append(getCurrentWorld);
setWorldInstructions.append(returnWorld);
														Generator.addMethod(setWorldMethod.getMethod());

Ya, i know there’s problems with it. Im trying to get the setWorld() method return world63.runescape.com.[/quote]I can’t really tell the problem just like that buut why are you trying to reach a field called “setWorld()”?

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL Problem
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Hello, I’m trying to change the web address in the client, so that it calls the setWorld() method. I have a code, that puts the method in the client, but it doesn’t function properly:

InstructionList setWorldInstructions = new InstructionList();
MethodGen setWorldMethod = new MethodGen(0, Type.STRING, Args, WorldArgs, "setWorld", Generator.getClassName(), setWorldInstructions, ConstantPool);
														
InstructionFactory Factory = new InstructionFactory(Generator, ConstantPool);
Instruction pushThis = new ALOAD(0);
Instruction getCurrentWorld = Factory.createFieldAccess(Generator.getClassName(),"setWorld()", Type.STRING, Constants.GETSTATIC);
Instruction returnWorld = Factory.createReturn(Type.STRING);
														
setWorldInstructions.append(pushThis);
setWorldInstructions.append(getCurrentWorld);
setWorldInstructions.append(returnWorld);
														Generator.addMethod(setWorldMethod.getMethod());

Ya, i know there’s problems with it. Im trying to get the setWorld() method return world63.runescape.com.

Read full topic
